name: SwitchRoot
description:
Represents the switch itself.
Renders a `<button>` element and a hidden `<input>` beside.

checked.description:
Whether the switch is currently active.

To render an uncontrolled switch, use the `defaultChecked` prop instead.

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

defaultChecked.description:
Whether the switch is initially active.

To render a controlled switch, use the `checked` prop instead.

disabled.description: Whether the component should ignore user actions.

inputRef.description: Ref to the underlying input element.

name.description: Name of the underlying input element.

onCheckedChange.description: Event handler called when the switch is activated or deactivated.

readOnly.description:
If `true`, the component is read-only.
Functionally, this is equivalent to being disabled, but the assistive technologies will announce this differently.

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.

required.description: If `true`, the switch must be checked for the browser validation to pass.
